    38â†’   T013: Replace cl:error with format-error signaling."
    39â†’  (cl:error 'clysm/conditions:format-error
    40â†’            :control-string control-string
    41â†’            :position position
    42â†’            :format-control format-control
    43â†’            :format-arguments format-args))
    44â†’
    45â†’;;; ============================================================
    46â†’;;; Format Directive Structures (T065, T066)
    47â†’;;; ============================================================
    48â†’
    49â†’(defstruct format-directive
    50â†’  "Represents a single format directive.
    51â†’   T065: FormatDirective struct."
    52â†’  (type nil :type keyword)
    53â†’  (start 0 :type fixnum)
    54â†’  (end 0 :type fixnum))
    55â†’
    56â†’(defstruct format-string-info
    57â†’  "Parsed format string information.
    58â†’   T066: FormatStringInfo struct."
    59â†’  (control-string "" :type string)
    60â†’  (directives nil :type list))
    61â†’
    62â†’;;; ============================================================
    63â†’;;; Nested Directive Structures (T027, T028, T040, T041, T050)
    64â†’;;; ============================================================
    65â†’
    66â†’;; Iteration directive: ~{body~}
    67â†’(defstruct (iteration-directive (:include format-directive))
    68â†’  "Iteration directive with nested body.
    69â†’   T027: iteration-directive struct with body-directives."
    70â†’  (body-directives nil :type list)
    71â†’  (body-string "" :type string))
    72â†’
    73â†’;; Escape directive: ~^ (exit iteration when no more elements)
    74â†’(defstruct (escape-directive (:include format-directive))
    75â†’  "Escape directive ~^ for iteration exit.
    76â†’   T028: escape-directive struct.")
    77â†’
    78â†’;; Conditional directive: ~[clause~;clause~]
    79â†’(defstruct (conditional-directive (:include format-directive))
    80â†’  "Conditional directive with clauses.
    81â†’   T040: conditional-directive struct."
    82â†’  (clauses nil :type list)
    83â†’  (boolean-p nil :type boolean)
    84â†’  (default-index nil))
    85â†’
    86â†’;; Clause info for conditional directive
    87â†’(defstruct clause-info
    88â†’  "Information about a conditional clause.
    89â†’   T041: clause-info struct."
    90â†’  (index 0 :type fixnum)
    91â†’  (directives nil :type list)
    92â†’  (default-p nil :type boolean)
    93â†’  (text "" :type string))  ; The clause body text for literal output
    94â†’
    95â†’;; Recursive directive: ~?
    96â†’(defstruct (recursive-directive (:include format-directive))
    97â†’  "Recursive directive for nested format strings.
    98â†’   T050: recursive-directive struct.")
    99â†’
   100â†’;;; ============================================================
   101â†’;;; Format String Parser (T067, T014)
   102â†’;;; ============================================================
   103â†’
   104â†’(defun parse-simple-directive (control-string start next-char)
   105â†’  "Parse a simple (non-nested) directive at position START.
   106â†’   T014: Dispatcher helper for simple directives.
   107â†’   Returns (directive . end-position)."
   108â†’  (let ((upchar (char-upcase next-char)))
   109â†’    (cond
   110â†’      ;; ~^ escape directive (T031)
   111â†’      ((char= upchar #\^)
   112â†’       (cons (make-escape-directive :type :escape :start start :end (+ start 2))
   113â†’             (+ start 2)))
   114â†’      ;; ~? recursive directive (T051)
   115â†’      ((char= upchar #\?)
   116â†’       (cons (make-recursive-directive :type :recursive :start start :end (+ start 2))
   117â†’             (+ start 2)))
   118â†’      ;; Other simple directives
   119â†’      (t
   120â†’       (let ((type (case upchar
   121â†’                     (#\A :aesthetic)
   122â†’                     (#\S :standard)
   123â†’                     (#\D :decimal)
   124â†’                     (#\% :newline)
   125â†’                     (#\~ :tilde)
   126â†’                     (#\& :fresh-line)  ; T018: Add fresh-line case
   127â†’                     (t nil))))
   128â†’         (if type
   129â†’             (cons (make-format-directive :type type :start start :end (+ start 2))
   130â†’                   (+ start 2))
   131â†’             nil))))))
   132â†’
   133â†’(defun parse-directive (control-string start)
   134â†’  "Parse a directive starting at position START.
   135â†’   T014: Dispatcher for simple and nested directives.
   136â†’   Returns (directive . end-position) or signals format-error."
   137â†’  (let ((len (length control-string)))
   138â†’    (when (>= (1+ start) len)
   139â†’      (signal-format-error control-string start "Format string ends with tilde"))
   140â†’    (let ((next-char (char control-string (1+ start))))
   141â†’      ;; Check for modifiers (colon for boolean conditional)
   142â†’      (cond
   143â†’        ;; ~:[ boolean conditional form
   144â†’        ((and (char= next-char #\:)
   145â†’              (< (+ start 2) len)
   146â†’              (char= (char-upcase (char control-string (+ start 2))) #\[))
   147â†’         (parse-conditional-directive control-string start t))
   148â†’        ;; ~[ conditional
   149â†’        ((char= (char-upcase next-char) #\[)
   150â†’         (parse-conditional-directive control-string start nil))
   151â†’        ;; ~{ iteration
   152â†’        ((char= (char-upcase next-char) #\{)
   153â†’         (parse-iteration-directive control-string start))
   154â†’        ;; Simple directives
   155â†’        (t
   156â†’         (let ((result (parse-simple-directive control-string start next-char)))
   157â†’           (if result
   158â†’               result
   159â†’               (signal-format-error control-string start
   160â†’                                    "Unknown format directive: ~~~C" next-char))))))))
   161â†’
   162â†’(defun parse-format-string (control-string)
   163â†’  "Parse CONTROL-STRING into format-string-info.
   164â†’   T067: Compile-time format string parsing.
   165â†’   T014: Uses parse-directive dispatcher for extensibility."
   166â†’  (let ((directives nil)
   167â†’        (len (length control-string))
   168â†’        (i 0))
   169â†’    (loop while (< i len)
   170â†’          for char = (char control-string i)
   171â†’          do (if (char= char #\~)
   172â†’                 (let ((result (parse-directive control-string i)))
   173â†’                   (push (car result) directives)
   174â†’                   (setf i (cdr result)))
   175â†’                 (incf i)))
   176â†’    (make-format-string-info
   177â†’     :control-string control-string
   178â†’     :directives (nreverse directives))))
   179â†’
   180â†’;;; ============================================================
   181â†’;;; Nested Directive Parsers (T029, T042)
   182â†’;;; ============================================================
   183â†’
   184â†’(defun find-matching-close (control-string start open-char close-char)
   185â†’  "Find position of matching close character, handling nesting.
   186â†’   START is position after the opening character."
   187â†’  (let ((len (length control-string))
   188â†’        (depth 1)
   189â†’        (i start))
   190â†’    (loop while (and (< i len) (> depth 0))
   191â†’          do (let ((char (char control-string i)))
   192â†’               (cond
   193â†’                 ((and (char= char #\~)
   194â†’                       (< (1+ i) len))
   195â†’                  (let ((next (char-upcase (char control-string (1+ i)))))
   196â†’                    (cond
   197â†’                      ((char= next open-char) (incf depth) (incf i 2))
   198â†’                      ((char= next close-char) (decf depth) (incf i 2))
   199â†’                      (t (incf i 2)))))
   200â†’                 (t (incf i)))))
   201â†’    (if (zerop depth)
   202â†’        (- i 2)  ; Position of ~} or ~]
   203â†’        nil)))
   204â†’
   205â†’(defun parse-iteration-directive (control-string start)
   206â†’  "Parse ~{body~} iteration directive.
   207â†’   T029: Parse iteration with nested body.
   208â†’   Returns (iteration-directive . end-position)."
   209â†’  (let* ((body-start (+ start 2))  ; After ~{
   210â†’         (close-pos (find-matching-close control-string body-start #\{ #\})))
   211â†’    (unless close-pos
   212â†’      (signal-format-error control-string start "Unclosed ~{ iteration directive"))
   213â†’    (let* ((body-string (subseq control-string body-start close-pos))
   214â†’           (body-info (parse-format-string body-string)))
   215â†’      (cons (make-iteration-directive
   216â†’             :type :iteration
   217â†’             :start start
   218â†’             :end (+ close-pos 2)
   219â†’             :body-directives (format-string-info-directives body-info)
   220â†’             :body-string body-string)
   221â†’            (+ close-pos 2)))))
   222â†’
   223â†’(defun parse-conditional-directive (control-string start boolean-p)
   224â†’  "Parse ~[clause~;clause~] or ~:[false~;true~] conditional directive.
   225â†’   T042: Parse conditional with clause separation.
   226â†’   BOOLEAN-P indicates ~:[ form.
   227â†’   Returns (conditional-directive . end-position)."
   228â†’  (let* ((body-start (if boolean-p (+ start 3) (+ start 2)))  ; After ~[ or ~:[
   229â†’         (close-pos (find-matching-close control-string body-start #\[ #\])))
   230â†’    (unless close-pos
   231â†’      (signal-format-error control-string start "Unclosed ~[ conditional directive"))
   232â†’    ;; Parse clauses separated by ~;
   233â†’    (let ((clauses nil)
   234â†’          (clause-index 0)
   235â†’          (default-index nil)
   236â†’          (clause-start body-start)
   237â†’          (i body-start))
   238â†’      (loop while (< i close-pos)
   239â†’            do (let ((char (char control-string i)))
   240â†’                 (cond
   241â†’                   ;; Found ~; clause separator or ~:; default
   242â†’                   ((and (char= char #\~)
   243â†’                         (< (1+ i) close-pos))
   244â†’                    (let ((next (char control-string (1+ i))))
   245â†’                      (cond
   246â†’                        ;; ~:; marks default clause
   247â†’                        ((and (char= next #\:)
   248â†’                              (< (+ i 2) close-pos)
   249â†’                              (char= (char control-string (+ i 2)) #\;))
   250â†’                         ;; Save current clause
   251â†’                         (let ((clause-text (subseq control-string clause-start i)))
   252â†’                           (push (make-clause-info
   253â†’                                  :index clause-index
   254â†’                                  :directives (format-string-info-directives
   255â†’                                               (parse-format-string clause-text))
   256â†’                                  :default-p nil
   257â†’                                  :text clause-text)
   258â†’                                 clauses))
   259â†’                         (setf default-index (1+ clause-index))
   260â†’                         (incf clause-index)
   261â†’                         (setf i (+ i 3))
   262â†’                         (setf clause-start i))
   263â†’                        ;; ~; regular separator
   264â†’                        ((char= next #\;)
   265â†’                         (let ((clause-text (subseq control-string clause-start i)))
   266â†’                           (push (make-clause-info
   267â†’                                  :index clause-index
   268â†’                                  :directives (format-string-info-directives
   269â†’                                               (parse-format-string clause-text))
   270â†’                                  :default-p nil
   271â†’                                  :text clause-text)
   272â†’                                 clauses))
   273â†’                         (incf clause-index)
   274â†’                         (setf i (+ i 2))
   275â†’                         (setf clause-start i))
   276â†’                        (t (incf i 2)))))
   277â†’                   (t (incf i)))))
   278â†’      ;; Final clause (or default clause after ~:;)
   279â†’      (let ((clause-text (subseq control-string clause-start close-pos)))
   280â†’        (push (make-clause-info
   281â†’               :index clause-index
   282â†’               :directives (format-string-info-directives
   283â†’                            (parse-format-string clause-text))
   284â†’               :default-p (not (null default-index))
   285â†’               :text clause-text)
   286â†’              clauses))
   287â†’      (cons (make-conditional-directive
   288â†’             :type :conditional
   289â†’             :start start
   290â†’             :end (+ close-pos 2)
   291â†’             :clauses (nreverse clauses)
   292â†’             :boolean-p boolean-p
   293â†’             :default-index default-index)
   294â†’            (+ close-pos 2)))))
   295â†’
   296â†’;;; ============================================================
   297â†’;;; Format Directive Handlers (T068-T072)
   298â†’;;; ============================================================
   299â†’
   300â†’(defun format-aesthetic (object stream)
   301â†’  "Format OBJECT using aesthetic (human-readable) representation.
   302â†’   T068: ~A directive handler - princ style."
   303â†’  (write-string (princ-to-string object) stream))
   304â†’
   305â†’(defun format-standard (object stream)
   306â†’  "Format OBJECT using standard (machine-readable) representation.
   307â†’   T069: ~S directive handler - prin1 style."
   308â†’  (write-string (prin1-to-string object) stream))
   309â†’
   310â†’(defun format-decimal (object stream)
   311â†’  "Format OBJECT as decimal integer.
   312â†’   T070: ~D directive handler."
   313â†’  (unless (integerp object)
   314â†’    (cl:error 'type-error :datum object :expected-type 'integer))
   315â†’  (write-string (princ-to-string object) stream))
   316â†’
   317â†’(defun format-newline (stream)
   318â†’  "Output a newline.
   319â†’   T071: ~% directive handler."
   320â†’  (write-char #\Newline stream))
   321â†’
   322â†’(defun format-tilde (stream)
   323â†’  "Output a literal tilde.
   324â†’   T072: ~~ directive handler."
   325â†’  (write-char #\~ stream))
   326â†’
   327â†’;;; ============================================================
   328â†’;;; Princ/Prin1 to String (helpers)
   329â†’;;; ============================================================
   330â†’
   331â†’(defun princ-to-string (object)
   332â†’  "Return aesthetic string representation of OBJECT.
   333â†’   Uses host CL's princ-to-string for non-trivial cases to avoid recursion."
   334â†’  (typecase object
   335â†’    (string object)
   336â†’    (character (string object))
   337â†’    ;; For other types, use host CL's princ-to-string
   338â†’    (t (cl:princ-to-string object))))
   339â†’
   340â†’(defun prin1-to-string (object)
   341â†’  "Return standard string representation of OBJECT.
   342â†’   Uses host CL's prin1-to-string for non-trivial cases to avoid recursion."
   343â†’  (typecase object
   344â†’    (string (concatenate 'string "\"" object "\""))
   345â†’    (character (cl:format nil "#\\~C" object))
   346â†’    ;; For other types, use host CL's prin1-to-string
   347â†’    (t (cl:prin1-to-string object))))
   348â†’
   349â†’;;; ============================================================
   350â†’;;; Format Function (FR-008 to FR-013, T073, T074, US3)
   351â†’;;; ============================================================
   352â†’
   353â†’(defun format (destination control-string &rest args)
   354â†’  "Format output according to CONTROL-STRING with ARGS.
   355â†’   FR-008: System MUST provide format function supporting destination argument.
   356â†’   FR-009: ~A directive (aesthetic printing).
   357â†’   FR-010: ~S directive (standard printing).
   358â†’   FR-011: ~D directive (decimal printing).
   359â†’   FR-012: ~% directive (newline).
   360â†’   FR-013: ~~ directive (tilde).
   361â†’   FR-014: ~& directive (fresh-line).
   362â†’   FR-016: ~{~} directive (iteration).
   363â†’   FR-017: ~^ directive (escape).
   364â†’   FR-018: ~[~] directive (conditional).
   365â†’   FR-019: ~? directive (recursive).
   366â†’
   367â†’   DESTINATION:
   368â†’   - T: output to *standard-output*, return NIL
   369â†’   - NIL: return formatted string
   370â†’   - stream: output to stream, return NIL"
   371â†’  (let* ((info (parse-format-string control-string))
   372â†’         (output-stream (cond
   373â†’                          ((eq destination t) *standard-output*)
   374â†’                          ((null destination) nil)
   375â†’                          ((streamp destination) destination)
   376â†’                          (t (signal-format-error control-string 0
   377â†’                                                  "Invalid destination: ~S" destination))))
   378â†’         (result-string (when (null destination)
   379â†’                          (make-array 0 :element-type 'character
   380â†’                                       :adjustable t :fill-pointer 0))))
   381â†’    ;; Reset column tracking for string output
   382â†’    (when (null destination)
   383â†’      (setf *format-column* 0))
   384â†’    ;; Execute directives with args
   385â†’    (multiple-value-bind (final-arg-index)
   386â†’        (execute-format-directives
   387â†’         (format-string-info-control-string info)
   388â†’         (format-string-info-directives info)
   389â†’         args 0
   390â†’         output-stream result-string)
   391â†’      (declare (ignore final-arg-index))
   392â†’      ;; Return value based on destination
   393â†’      (if result-string
   394â†’          (coerce result-string 'string)
   395â†’          nil))))
   396â†’
   397â†’;;; ============================================================
   398â†’;;; Format Directive Execution (T019, T020, T032-T034, T044-T045, T052-T053)
   399â†’;;; ============================================================
   400â†’
   401â†’(defun execute-format-directives (control directives args arg-index stream result-string)
   402â†’  "Execute a list of directives, returning final arg-index.
   403â†’   Helper for recursive directive processing."
   404â†’  (let ((last-pos 0))
   405â†’    (dolist (directive directives)
   406â†’      ;; Output literal text before directive
   407â†’      (let ((start last-pos)
   408â†’            (end (format-directive-start directive)))
   409â†’        (when (< start end)
   410â†’          (format-output-string (subseq control start end) stream result-string)))
   411â†’
   412â†’      ;; Process directive based on type
   413â†’      (setf arg-index
   414â†’            (execute-single-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))
   415â†’
   416â†’      (setf last-pos (format-directive-end directive)))
   417â†’
   418â†’    ;; Output remaining literal text
   419â†’    (when (< last-pos (length control))
   420â†’      (format-output-string (subseq control last-pos) stream result-string))
   421â†’
   422â†’    arg-index))
   423â†’
   424â†’(defun execute-single-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
   425â†’  "Execute a single directive, returning updated arg-index."
   426â†’  (let ((dtype (format-directive-type directive)))
   427â†’    (case dtype
   428â†’      ;; ~A aesthetic
   429â†’      (:aesthetic
   430â†’       (when (>= arg-index (length args))
   431â†’         (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   432â†’                              "Not enough arguments for ~~A"))
   433â†’       (format-output-string (princ-to-string (nth arg-index args)) stream result-string)
   434â†’       (1+ arg-index))
   435â†’
   436â†’      ;; ~S standard
   437â†’      (:standard
   438â†’       (when (>= arg-index (length args))
   439â†’         (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   440â†’                              "Not enough arguments for ~~S"))
   441â†’       (format-output-string (prin1-to-string (nth arg-index args)) stream result-string)
   442â†’       (1+ arg-index))
   443â†’
   444â†’      ;; ~D decimal
   445â†’      (:decimal
   446â†’       (when (>= arg-index (length args))
   447â†’         (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   448â†’                              "Not enough arguments for ~~D"))
   449â†’       (let ((arg (nth arg-index args)))
   450â†’         (unless (integerp arg)
   451â†’           (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   452â†’                                "~~D requires integer, got ~S" arg))
   453â†’         (format-output-string (princ-to-string arg) stream result-string))
   454â†’       (1+ arg-index))
   455â†’
   456â†’      ;; ~% newline
   457â†’      (:newline
   458â†’       (format-output-char #\Newline stream result-string)
   459â†’       arg-index)
   460â†’
   461â†’      ;; ~~ tilde
   462â†’      (:tilde
   463â†’       (format-output-char #\~ stream result-string)
   464â†’       arg-index)
   465â†’
   466â†’      ;; ~& fresh-line (T019, T020)
   467â†’      (:fresh-line
   468â†’       (unless (zerop *format-column*)
   469â†’         (format-output-char #\Newline stream result-string))
   470â†’       arg-index)
   471â†’
   472â†’      ;; ~{~} iteration (T032, T033, T034)
   473â†’      (:iteration
   474â†’       (execute-iteration-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))
   475â†’
   476â†’      ;; ~^ escape - only valid inside iteration, handled there
   477â†’      (:escape
   478â†’       (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   479â†’                            "~~^ outside of iteration context"))
   480â†’
   481â†’      ;; ~[~] conditional (T044, T045)
   482â†’      (:conditional
   483â†’       (execute-conditional-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))
   484â†’
   485â†’      ;; ~? recursive (T052, T053)
   486â†’      (:recursive
   487â†’       (execute-recursive-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))
   488â†’
   489â†’      ;; Unknown directive type
   490â†’      (otherwise
   491â†’       (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   492â†’                            "Unknown directive type: ~S" dtype)))))
   493â†’
   494â†’;;; ============================================================
   495â†’;;; Iteration Execution (T032, T033)
   496â†’;;; ============================================================
   497â†’
   498â†’(defun execute-iteration-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
   499â†’  "Execute ~{body~} iteration directive.
   500â†’   T032: Loop over list elements.
   501â†’   T033: Handle ~^ escape.
   502â†’   Returns updated arg-index."
   503â†’  (when (>= arg-index (length args))
   504â†’    (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   505â†’                         "Not enough arguments for ~~{~~}"))
   506â†’  (let ((list-arg (nth arg-index args)))
   507â†’    (unless (listp list-arg)
   508â†’      (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   509â†’                           "~~{ requires a list argument, got ~S" list-arg))
   510â†’    (let ((body-directives (iteration-directive-body-directives directive))
   511â†’          (body-string (iteration-directive-body-string directive)))
   512â†’      ;; Process each element
   513â†’      (loop for remaining on list-arg
   514â†’            for item = (car remaining)
   515â†’            do (block iteration-body
   516â†’                 (let ((body-last-pos 0))
   517â†’                   (dolist (body-dir body-directives)
   518â†’                     ;; Literal text
   519â†’                     (let ((start body-last-pos)
   520â†’                           (end (format-directive-start body-dir)))
   521â†’                       (when (< start end)
   522â†’                         (format-output-string (subseq body-string start end)
   523â†’                                               stream result-string)))
   524â†’                     ;; Handle ~^ escape
   525â†’                     (when (eq (format-directive-type body-dir) :escape)
   526â†’                       (when (null (cdr remaining))
   527â†’                         (return-from iteration-body)))
   528â†’                     ;; Other directives use item as single-element arg list
   529â†’                     (unless (eq (format-directive-type body-dir) :escape)
   530â†’                       (execute-single-directive body-dir body-string (list item) 0
   531â†’                                                 stream result-string))
   532â†’                     (setf body-last-pos (format-directive-end body-dir)))
   533â†’                   ;; Remaining literal text
   534â†’                   (when (< body-last-pos (length body-string))
   535â†’                     (format-output-string (subseq body-string body-last-pos)
   536â†’                                           stream result-string)))))))
   537â†’  (1+ arg-index))
   538â†’
   539â†’;;; ============================================================
   540â†’;;; Conditional Execution (T044)
   541â†’;;; ============================================================
   542â†’
   543â†’(defun execute-conditional-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
   544â†’  "Execute ~[clause~;clause~] or ~:[false~;true~] conditional directive.
   545â†’   T044: Select clause by index or boolean.
   546â†’   Returns updated arg-index."
   547â†’  (when (>= arg-index (length args))
   548â†’    (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   549â†’                         "Not enough arguments for ~~[~~]"))
   550â†’  (let* ((arg (nth arg-index args))
   551â†’         (clauses (conditional-directive-clauses directive))
   552â†’         (boolean-p (conditional-directive-boolean-p directive))
   553â†’         (default-index (conditional-directive-default-index directive))
   554â†’         ;; Determine which clause to execute
   555â†’         (index (if boolean-p
   556â†’                    (if arg 1 0)  ; Non-nil -> 1, nil -> 0
   557â†’                    (progn
   558â†’                      (unless (integerp arg)
   559â†’                        (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
   560â†’                                             "~~[ requires integer argument, got ~S" arg))

;;;; format.lisp - Format function implementation
;;;; FFI-based stream I/O (015-ffi-stream-io)
;;;; Extended for 032-format-function

(in-package #:clysm/streams)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Column Tracking (T011, T012)
;;; ============================================================

(defvar *format-column* 0
  "Current column position for format output.
   T011: Column tracking for ~& fresh-line support.
   0 after newline, incremented for other characters.")

(defun format-output-char (char stream result-string)
  "Output CHAR to stream or result-string, tracking column.
   T012: Update column after each character output."
  (if result-string
      (vector-push-extend char result-string)
      (write-char char stream))
  ;; Update column tracking
  (if (char= char #\Newline)
      (setf *format-column* 0)
      (incf *format-column*)))

(defun format-output-string (str stream result-string)
  "Output STR to stream or result-string, tracking column."
  (loop for c across str
        do (format-output-char c stream result-string)))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Format Error Signaling (T013)
;;; ============================================================

(defun signal-format-error (control-string position format-control &rest format-args)
  "Signal a format-error condition.
   T013: Replace cl:error with format-error signaling."
  (cl:error 'clysm/conditions:format-error
            :control-string control-string
            :position position
            :format-control format-control
            :format-arguments format-args))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Format Directive Structures (T065, T066)
;;; ============================================================

(defstruct format-directive
  "Represents a single format directive.
   T065: FormatDirective struct."
  (type nil :type keyword)
  (start 0 :type fixnum)
  (end 0 :type fixnum))

(defstruct format-string-info
  "Parsed format string information.
   T066: FormatStringInfo struct."
  (control-string "" :type string)
  (directives nil :type list))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Nested Directive Structures (T027, T028, T040, T041, T050)
;;; ============================================================

;; Iteration directive: ~{body~}
(defstruct (iteration-directive (:include format-directive))
  "Iteration directive with nested body.
   T027: iteration-directive struct with body-directives."
  (body-directives nil :type list)
  (body-string "" :type string))

;; Escape directive: ~^ (exit iteration when no more elements)
(defstruct (escape-directive (:include format-directive))
  "Escape directive ~^ for iteration exit.
   T028: escape-directive struct.")

;; Conditional directive: ~[clause~;clause~]
(defstruct (conditional-directive (:include format-directive))
  "Conditional directive with clauses.
   T040: conditional-directive struct."
  (clauses nil :type list)
  (boolean-p nil :type boolean)
  (default-index nil))

;; Clause info for conditional directive
(defstruct clause-info
  "Information about a conditional clause.
   T041: clause-info struct."
  (index 0 :type fixnum)
  (directives nil :type list)
  (default-p nil :type boolean)
  (text "" :type string))  ; The clause body text for literal output

;; Recursive directive: ~?
(defstruct (recursive-directive (:include format-directive))
  "Recursive directive for nested format strings.
   T050: recursive-directive struct.")

;;; ============================================================
;;; Format String Parser (T067, T014)
;;; ============================================================

(defun parse-simple-directive (control-string start next-char)
  "Parse a simple (non-nested) directive at position START.
   T014: Dispatcher helper for simple directives.
   Returns (directive . end-position)."
  (let ((upchar (char-upcase next-char)))
    (cond
      ;; ~^ escape directive (T031)
      ((char= upchar #\^)
       (cons (make-escape-directive :type :escape :start start :end (+ start 2))
             (+ start 2)))
      ;; ~? recursive directive (T051)
      ((char= upchar #\?)
       (cons (make-recursive-directive :type :recursive :start start :end (+ start 2))
             (+ start 2)))
      ;; Other simple directives
      (t
       (let ((type (case upchar
                     (#\A :aesthetic)
                     (#\S :standard)
                     (#\D :decimal)
                     (#\% :newline)
                     (#\~ :tilde)
                     (#\& :fresh-line)  ; T018: Add fresh-line case
                     (t nil))))
         (if type
             (cons (make-format-directive :type type :start start :end (+ start 2))
                   (+ start 2))
             nil))))))

(defun parse-directive (control-string start)
  "Parse a directive starting at position START.
   T014: Dispatcher for simple and nested directives.
   Returns (directive . end-position) or signals format-error."
  (let ((len (length control-string)))
    (when (>= (1+ start) len)
      (signal-format-error control-string start "Format string ends with tilde"))
    (let ((next-char (char control-string (1+ start))))
      ;; Check for modifiers (colon for boolean conditional)
      (cond
        ;; ~:[ boolean conditional form
        ((and (char= next-char #\:)
              (< (+ start 2) len)
              (char= (char-upcase (char control-string (+ start 2))) #\[))
         (parse-conditional-directive control-string start t))
        ;; ~[ conditional
        ((char= (char-upcase next-char) #\[)
         (parse-conditional-directive control-string start nil))
        ;; ~{ iteration
        ((char= (char-upcase next-char) #\{)
         (parse-iteration-directive control-string start))
        ;; Simple directives
        (t
         (let ((result (parse-simple-directive control-string start next-char)))
           (if result
               result
               (signal-format-error control-string start
                                    "Unknown format directive: ~~~C" next-char))))))))

(defun parse-format-string (control-string)
  "Parse CONTROL-STRING into format-string-info.
   T067: Compile-time format string parsing.
   T014: Uses parse-directive dispatcher for extensibility."
  (let ((directives nil)
        (len (length control-string))
        (i 0))
    (loop while (< i len)
          for char = (char control-string i)
          do (if (char= char #\~)
                 (let ((result (parse-directive control-string i)))
                   (push (car result) directives)
                   (setf i (cdr result)))
                 (incf i)))
    (make-format-string-info
     :control-string control-string
     :directives (nreverse directives))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Nested Directive Parsers (T029, T042)
;;; ============================================================

(defun find-matching-close (control-string start open-char close-char)
  "Find position of matching close character, handling nesting.
   START is position after the opening character."
  (let ((len (length control-string))
        (depth 1)
        (i start))
    (loop while (and (< i len) (> depth 0))
          do (let ((char (char control-string i)))
               (cond
                 ((and (char= char #\~)
                       (< (1+ i) len))
                  (let ((next (char-upcase (char control-string (1+ i)))))
                    (cond
                      ((char= next open-char) (incf depth) (incf i 2))
                      ((char= next close-char) (decf depth) (incf i 2))
                      (t (incf i 2)))))
                 (t (incf i)))))
    (if (zerop depth)
        (- i 2)  ; Position of ~} or ~]
        nil)))

(defun parse-iteration-directive (control-string start)
  "Parse ~{body~} iteration directive.
   T029: Parse iteration with nested body.
   Returns (iteration-directive . end-position)."
  (let* ((body-start (+ start 2))  ; After ~{
         (close-pos (find-matching-close control-string body-start #\{ #\})))
    (unless close-pos
      (signal-format-error control-string start "Unclosed ~{ iteration directive"))
    (let* ((body-string (subseq control-string body-start close-pos))
           (body-info (parse-format-string body-string)))
      (cons (make-iteration-directive
             :type :iteration
             :start start
             :end (+ close-pos 2)
             :body-directives (format-string-info-directives body-info)
             :body-string body-string)
            (+ close-pos 2)))))

(defun parse-conditional-directive (control-string start boolean-p)
  "Parse ~[clause~;clause~] or ~:[false~;true~] conditional directive.
   T042: Parse conditional with clause separation.
   BOOLEAN-P indicates ~:[ form.
   Returns (conditional-directive . end-position)."
  (let* ((body-start (if boolean-p (+ start 3) (+ start 2)))  ; After ~[ or ~:[
         (close-pos (find-matching-close control-string body-start #\[ #\])))
    (unless close-pos
      (signal-format-error control-string start "Unclosed ~[ conditional directive"))
    ;; Parse clauses separated by ~;
    (let ((clauses nil)
          (clause-index 0)
          (default-index nil)
          (clause-start body-start)
          (i body-start))
      (loop while (< i close-pos)
            do (let ((char (char control-string i)))
                 (cond
                   ;; Found ~; clause separator or ~:; default
                   ((and (char= char #\~)
                         (< (1+ i) close-pos))
                    (let ((next (char control-string (1+ i))))
                      (cond
                        ;; ~:; marks default clause
                        ((and (char= next #\:)
                              (< (+ i 2) close-pos)
                              (char= (char control-string (+ i 2)) #\;))
                         ;; Save current clause
                         (let ((clause-text (subseq control-string clause-start i)))
                           (push (make-clause-info
                                  :index clause-index
                                  :directives (format-string-info-directives
                                               (parse-format-string clause-text))
                                  :default-p nil
                                  :text clause-text)
                                 clauses))
                         (setf default-index (1+ clause-index))
                         (incf clause-index)
                         (setf i (+ i 3))
                         (setf clause-start i))
                        ;; ~; regular separator
                        ((char= next #\;)
                         (let ((clause-text (subseq control-string clause-start i)))
                           (push (make-clause-info
                                  :index clause-index
                                  :directives (format-string-info-directives
                                               (parse-format-string clause-text))
                                  :default-p nil
                                  :text clause-text)
                                 clauses))
                         (incf clause-index)
                         (setf i (+ i 2))
                         (setf clause-start i))
                        (t (incf i 2)))))
                   (t (incf i)))))
      ;; Final clause (or default clause after ~:;)
      (let ((clause-text (subseq control-string clause-start close-pos)))
        (push (make-clause-info
               :index clause-index
               :directives (format-string-info-directives
                            (parse-format-string clause-text))
               :default-p (not (null default-index))
               :text clause-text)
              clauses))
      (cons (make-conditional-directive
             :type :conditional
             :start start
             :end (+ close-pos 2)
             :clauses (nreverse clauses)
             :boolean-p boolean-p
             :default-index default-index)
            (+ close-pos 2)))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Format Directive Handlers (T068-T072)
;;; ============================================================

(defun format-aesthetic (object stream)
  "Format OBJECT using aesthetic (human-readable) representation.
   T068: ~A directive handler - princ style."
  (write-string (princ-to-string object) stream))

(defun format-standard (object stream)
  "Format OBJECT using standard (machine-readable) representation.
   T069: ~S directive handler - prin1 style."
  (write-string (prin1-to-string object) stream))

(defun format-decimal (object stream)
  "Format OBJECT as decimal integer.
   T070: ~D directive handler."
  (unless (integerp object)
    (cl:error 'type-error :datum object :expected-type 'integer))
  (write-string (princ-to-string object) stream))

(defun format-newline (stream)
  "Output a newline.
   T071: ~% directive handler."
  (write-char #\Newline stream))

(defun format-tilde (stream)
  "Output a literal tilde.
   T072: ~~ directive handler."
  (write-char #\~ stream))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Princ/Prin1 to String (helpers)
;;; ============================================================

(defun princ-to-string (object)
  "Return aesthetic string representation of OBJECT.
   Uses host CL's princ-to-string for non-trivial cases to avoid recursion."
  (typecase object
    (string object)
    (character (string object))
    ;; For other types, use host CL's princ-to-string
    (t (cl:princ-to-string object))))

(defun prin1-to-string (object)
  "Return standard string representation of OBJECT.
   Uses host CL's prin1-to-string for non-trivial cases to avoid recursion."
  (typecase object
    (string (concatenate 'string "\"" object "\""))
    (character (cl:format nil "#\\~C" object))
    ;; For other types, use host CL's prin1-to-string
    (t (cl:prin1-to-string object))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Format Function (FR-008 to FR-013, T073, T074, US3)
;;; ============================================================

(defun format (destination control-string &rest args)
  "Format output according to CONTROL-STRING with ARGS.
   FR-008: System MUST provide format function supporting destination argument.
   FR-009: ~A directive (aesthetic printing).
   FR-010: ~S directive (standard printing).
   FR-011: ~D directive (decimal printing).
   FR-012: ~% directive (newline).
   FR-013: ~~ directive (tilde).
   FR-014: ~& directive (fresh-line).
   FR-016: ~{~} directive (iteration).
   FR-017: ~^ directive (escape).
   FR-018: ~[~] directive (conditional).
   FR-019: ~? directive (recursive).

   DESTINATION:
   - T: output to *standard-output*, return NIL
   - NIL: return formatted string
   - stream: output to stream, return NIL"
  (let* ((info (parse-format-string control-string))
         (output-stream (cond
                          ((eq destination t) *standard-output*)
                          ((null destination) nil)
                          ((streamp destination) destination)
                          (t (signal-format-error control-string 0
                                                  "Invalid destination: ~S" destination))))
         (result-string (when (null destination)
                          (make-array 0 :element-type 'character
                                       :adjustable t :fill-pointer 0))))
    ;; Reset column tracking for string output
    (when (null destination)
      (setf *format-column* 0))
    ;; Execute directives with args
    (multiple-value-bind (final-arg-index)
        (execute-format-directives
         (format-string-info-control-string info)
         (format-string-info-directives info)
         args 0
         output-stream result-string)
      (declare (ignore final-arg-index))
      ;; Return value based on destination
      (if result-string
          (coerce result-string 'string)
          nil))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Format Directive Execution (T019, T020, T032-T034, T044-T045, T052-T053)
;;; ============================================================

(defun execute-format-directives (control directives args arg-index stream result-string)
  "Execute a list of directives, returning final arg-index.
   Helper for recursive directive processing."
  (let ((last-pos 0))
    (dolist (directive directives)
      ;; Output literal text before directive
      (let ((start last-pos)
            (end (format-directive-start directive)))
        (when (< start end)
          (format-output-string (subseq control start end) stream result-string)))

      ;; Process directive based on type
      (setf arg-index
            (execute-single-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))

      (setf last-pos (format-directive-end directive)))

    ;; Output remaining literal text
    (when (< last-pos (length control))
      (format-output-string (subseq control last-pos) stream result-string))

    arg-index))

(defun execute-single-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
  "Execute a single directive, returning updated arg-index."
  (let ((dtype (format-directive-type directive)))
    (case dtype
      ;; ~A aesthetic
      (:aesthetic
       (when (>= arg-index (length args))
         (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                              "Not enough arguments for ~~A"))
       (format-output-string (princ-to-string (nth arg-index args)) stream result-string)
       (1+ arg-index))

      ;; ~S standard
      (:standard
       (when (>= arg-index (length args))
         (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                              "Not enough arguments for ~~S"))
       (format-output-string (prin1-to-string (nth arg-index args)) stream result-string)
       (1+ arg-index))

      ;; ~D decimal
      (:decimal
       (when (>= arg-index (length args))
         (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                              "Not enough arguments for ~~D"))
       (let ((arg (nth arg-index args)))
         (unless (integerp arg)
           (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                                "~~D requires integer, got ~S" arg))
         (format-output-string (princ-to-string arg) stream result-string))
       (1+ arg-index))

      ;; ~% newline
      (:newline
       (format-output-char #\Newline stream result-string)
       arg-index)

      ;; ~~ tilde
      (:tilde
       (format-output-char #\~ stream result-string)
       arg-index)

      ;; ~& fresh-line (T019, T020)
      (:fresh-line
       (unless (zerop *format-column*)
         (format-output-char #\Newline stream result-string))
       arg-index)

      ;; ~{~} iteration (T032, T033, T034)
      (:iteration
       (execute-iteration-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))

      ;; ~^ escape - only valid inside iteration, handled there
      (:escape
       (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                            "~~^ outside of iteration context"))

      ;; ~[~] conditional (T044, T045)
      (:conditional
       (execute-conditional-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))

      ;; ~? recursive (T052, T053)
      (:recursive
       (execute-recursive-directive directive control args arg-index stream result-string))

      ;; Unknown directive type
      (otherwise
       (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                            "Unknown directive type: ~S" dtype)))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Iteration Execution (T032, T033)
;;; ============================================================

(defun execute-iteration-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
  "Execute ~{body~} iteration directive.
   T032: Loop over list elements.
   T033: Handle ~^ escape.
   Returns updated arg-index."
  (when (>= arg-index (length args))
    (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                         "Not enough arguments for ~~{~~}"))
  (let ((list-arg (nth arg-index args)))
    (unless (listp list-arg)
      (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                           "~~{ requires a list argument, got ~S" list-arg))
    (let ((body-directives (iteration-directive-body-directives directive))
          (body-string (iteration-directive-body-string directive)))
      ;; Process each element
      (loop for remaining on list-arg
            for item = (car remaining)
            do (block iteration-body
                 (let ((body-last-pos 0))
                   (dolist (body-dir body-directives)
                     ;; Literal text
                     (let ((start body-last-pos)
                           (end (format-directive-start body-dir)))
                       (when (< start end)
                         (format-output-string (subseq body-string start end)
                                               stream result-string)))
                     ;; Handle ~^ escape
                     (when (eq (format-directive-type body-dir) :escape)
                       (when (null (cdr remaining))
                         (return-from iteration-body)))
                     ;; Other directives use item as single-element arg list
                     (unless (eq (format-directive-type body-dir) :escape)
                       (execute-single-directive body-dir body-string (list item) 0
                                                 stream result-string))
                     (setf body-last-pos (format-directive-end body-dir)))
                   ;; Remaining literal text
                   (when (< body-last-pos (length body-string))
                     (format-output-string (subseq body-string body-last-pos)
                                           stream result-string)))))))
  (1+ arg-index))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Conditional Execution (T044)
;;; ============================================================

(defun execute-conditional-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
  "Execute ~[clause~;clause~] or ~:[false~;true~] conditional directive.
   T044: Select clause by index or boolean.
   Returns updated arg-index."
  (when (>= arg-index (length args))
    (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                         "Not enough arguments for ~~[~~]"))
  (let* ((arg (nth arg-index args))
         (clauses (conditional-directive-clauses directive))
         (boolean-p (conditional-directive-boolean-p directive))
         (default-index (conditional-directive-default-index directive))
         ;; Determine which clause to execute
         (index (if boolean-p
                    (if arg 1 0)  ; Non-nil -> 1, nil -> 0
                    (progn
                      (unless (integerp arg)
                        (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                                             "~~[ requires integer argument, got ~S" arg))
                      arg)))
         ;; Find the clause to execute
         (selected-clause (or (find index clauses :key #'clause-info-index)
                              (and default-index
                                   (find default-index clauses :key #'clause-info-index)))))
    (when selected-clause
      ;; Execute the clause using its stored text and directives
      (execute-format-directives (clause-info-text selected-clause)
                                 (clause-info-directives selected-clause)
                                 nil 0  ; Conditionals don't consume additional args
                                 stream result-string)))
  (1+ arg-index))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Recursive Execution (T052)
;;; ============================================================

(defun execute-recursive-directive (directive control args arg-index stream result-string)
  "Execute ~? recursive directive.
   T052: Consume format-string and args-list, call format recursively.
   Returns updated arg-index (+ 2)."
  (when (>= (1+ arg-index) (length args))
    (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                         "Not enough arguments for ~~? (need format-string and args-list)"))
  (let ((sub-control (nth arg-index args))
        (sub-args (nth (1+ arg-index) args)))
    (unless (stringp sub-control)
      (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                           "~~? first argument must be a string, got ~S" sub-control))
    (unless (listp sub-args)
      (signal-format-error control (format-directive-start directive)
                           "~~? second argument must be a list, got ~S" sub-args))
    ;; Recursive format call
    (let ((sub-result (apply #'format nil sub-control sub-args)))
      (format-output-string sub-result stream result-string)))
  (+ arg-index 2))

1â†’;;;; destructuring.lisp - Destructuring lambda-list parsing utilities
     2â†’;;;; Phase 9B - destructuring-bind macro support (031-destructuring-bind-macro)
     3â†’
     4â†’(in-package #:clysm/lib/destructuring)
     5â†’
     6â†’;;; ============================================================
     7â†’;;; Parsed Lambda-List Structure
     8â†’;;; ============================================================
     9â†’
    10â†’(defstruct parsed-lambda-list
    11â†’  "Intermediate representation of a destructuring lambda-list after parsing.
    12â†’   Stores all components extracted from the lambda-list pattern."
    13â†’  (whole-var nil :type (or null symbol))
    14â†’  (required-params nil :type list)
    15â†’  (optional-params nil :type list)
    16â†’  (rest-var nil :type (or null symbol))
    17â†’  (key-params nil :type list)
    18â†’  (allow-other-keys-p nil :type boolean))
    19â†’
    20â†’;;; ============================================================
    21â†’;;; Parameter Specification Structures
    22â†’;;; ============================================================
    23â†’
    24â†’(defstruct param-spec
    25â†’  "Represents a required positional parameter.
    26â†’   TYPE: :variable for simple symbols, :nested for nested patterns
    27â†’   VAR: The variable symbol (when type = :variable)
    28â†’   NESTED-LIST: A parsed-lambda-list (when type = :nested)"
    29â†’  (type :variable :type keyword)
    30â†’  (var nil :type (or null symbol))
    31â†’  (nested-list nil :type (or null parsed-lambda-list)))
    32â†’
    33â†’(defstruct optional-param-spec
    34â†’  "Represents an &optional parameter with optional default and supplied-p.
    35â†’   PARAM: The parameter (param-spec - variable or nested)
    36â†’   DEFAULT-FORM: Expression evaluated if not supplied (default: nil)
    37â†’   SUPPLIED-P: Variable bound to T/NIL indicating if supplied"
    38â†’  (param nil :type (or null param-spec))
    39â†’  (default-form nil :type t)
    40â†’  (supplied-p nil :type (or null symbol)))
    41â†’
    42â†’(defstruct key-param-spec
    43â†’  "Represents a &key parameter with keyword name, default, and supplied-p.
    44â†’   KEYWORD: The keyword symbol used in the plist (:foo)
    45â†’   PARAM: The variable or nested pattern (param-spec)
    46â†’   DEFAULT-FORM: Expression evaluated if not supplied
    47â†’   SUPPLIED-P: Variable bound to T/NIL indicating if supplied"
    48â†’  (keyword nil :type (or null keyword))
    49â†’  (param nil :type (or null param-spec))
    50â†’  (default-form nil :type t)
    51â†’  (supplied-p nil :type (or null symbol)))
    52â†’
    53â†’;;; ============================================================
    54â†’;;; Lambda-List Keyword Detection
    55â†’;;; ============================================================
    56â†’
    57â†’(defun lambda-list-keyword-p (item)
    58â†’  "Return true if ITEM is a lambda-list keyword."
    59â†’  (member item '(&whole &optional &rest &body &key &allow-other-keys)))
    60â†’
    61â†’;;; ============================================================
    62â†’;;; Parameter Parsing
    63â†’;;; ============================================================
    64â†’
    65â†’(defun parse-param (item)
    66â†’  "Parse a single required parameter.
    67â†’   ITEM: Either a symbol (variable) or a list (nested pattern).
    68â†’   Returns: A param-spec structure."
    69â†’  (cond
    70â†’    ((symbolp item)
    71â†’     ;; Simple variable
    72â†’     (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item))
    73â†’    ((listp item)
    74â†’     ;; Nested destructuring pattern
    75â†’     (make-param-spec :type :nested
    76â†’                      :nested-list (parse-destructuring-lambda-list item)))
    77â†’    (t
    78â†’     (error 'program-error
    79â†’            :format-control "Invalid destructuring parameter: ~S"
    80â†’            :format-arguments (list item)))))
    81â†’
    82â†’(defun parse-optional-param (item)
    83â†’  "Parse an &optional parameter specification.
    84â†’   Formats: var | (var) | (var default) | (var default supplied-p)
    85â†’   Where var can be a symbol or nested pattern.
    86â†’   Returns: An optional-param-spec structure."
    87â†’  (cond
    88â†’    ((symbolp item)
    89â†’     ;; Simple variable, no default, no supplied-p
    90â†’     (make-optional-param-spec
    91â†’      :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item)
    92â†’      :default-form nil
    93â†’      :supplied-p nil))
    94â†’    ((listp item)
    95â†’     (let ((var-part (first item))
    96â†’           (default (second item))
    97â†’           (supplied-p (third item)))
    98â†’       (make-optional-param-spec
    99â†’        :param (parse-param var-part)
   100â†’        :default-form default
   101â†’        :supplied-p supplied-p)))
   102â†’    (t
   103â†’     (error 'program-error
   104â†’            :format-control "Invalid &optional parameter: ~S"
   105â†’            :format-arguments (list item)))))
   106â†’
   107â†’(defun parse-key-param (item)
   108â†’  "Parse a &key parameter specification.
   109â†’   Formats: var | (var default) | (var default supplied-p) |
   110â†’            ((keyword var) default) | ((keyword var) default supplied-p)
   111â†’   Returns: A key-param-spec structure."
   112â†’  (cond
   113â†’    ((symbolp item)
   114â†’     ;; Simple variable, keyword derived from name
   115â†’     (make-key-param-spec
   116â†’      :keyword (intern (symbol-name item) :keyword)
   117â†’      :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item)
   118â†’      :default-form nil
   119â†’      :supplied-p nil))
   120â†’    ((listp item)
   121â†’     (let ((var-part (first item))
   122â†’           (default (second item))
   123â†’           (supplied-p (third item)))
   124â†’       (cond
   125â†’         ;; ((keyword var) ...) form
   126â†’         ((and (listp var-part) (= 2 (length var-part)))
   127â†’          (let ((keyword (first var-part))
   128â†’                (var (second var-part)))
   129â†’            (make-key-param-spec
   130â†’             :keyword (if (keywordp keyword)
   131â†’                          keyword
   132â†’                          (intern (symbol-name keyword) :keyword))
   133â†’             :param (parse-param var)
   134â†’             :default-form default
   135â†’             :supplied-p supplied-p)))
   136â†’         ;; (var ...) form
   137â†’         ((symbolp var-part)
   138â†’          (make-key-param-spec
   139â†’           :keyword (intern (symbol-name var-part) :keyword)
   140â†’           :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var var-part)
   141â†’           :default-form default
   142â†’           :supplied-p supplied-p))
   143â†’         ;; (nested-list default) form - not supported
   144â†’         ((listp var-part)
   145â†’          (error 'program-error
   146â†’                 :format-control "Nested patterns in &key require explicit keyword: ~S"
   147â†’                 :format-arguments (list item)))
   148â†’         (t
   149â†’          (error 'program-error
   150â†’                 :format-control "Invalid &key parameter: ~S"
   151â†’                 :format-arguments (list item))))))
   152â†’    (t
   153â†’     (error 'program-error
   154â†’            :format-control "Invalid &key parameter: ~S"
   155â†’            :format-arguments (list item)))))
   156â†’
   157â†’;;; ============================================================
   158â†’;;; Lambda-List Parsing (State Machine)
   159â†’;;; ============================================================
   160â†’
   161â†’(defun parse-destructuring-lambda-list (lambda-list)
   162â†’  "Parse a destructuring lambda-list into a parsed-lambda-list structure.
   163â†’   Uses a state machine as specified in data-model.md:
   164â†’   START -> AFTER-WHOLE -> REQUIRED -> OPTIONAL -> REST -> KEY -> ALLOW-KEYS -> END
   165â†’
   166â†’   Signals PROGRAM-ERROR for:
   167â†’   - Invalid lambda-list keywords
   168â†’   - Keywords in wrong order
   169â†’   - Duplicate keywords"
   170â†’  (let ((state :start)
   171â†’        (whole-var nil)
   172â†’        (required-params nil)
   173â†’        (optional-params nil)
   174â†’        (rest-var nil)
   175â†’        (key-params nil)
   176â†’        (allow-other-keys-p nil)
   177â†’        (remaining lambda-list))
   178â†’
   179â†’    ;; Handle dotted list case - convert to proper list with &rest
   180â†’    (when (and (listp remaining) (not (null remaining)))
   181â†’      (let ((last-cons (last remaining)))
   182â†’        (when (and last-cons (cdr last-cons) (not (listp (cdr last-cons))))
   183â†’          ;; Dotted list: (a b . c) -> (a b &rest c)
   184â†’          (setf remaining
   185â†’                (append (butlast remaining)
   186â†’                        (list (car last-cons) '&rest (cdr last-cons)))))))
   187â†’
   188â†’    (loop while remaining do
   189â†’      (let ((item (car remaining)))
   190â†’        (cond
   191â†’          ;; &whole - must be first
   192â†’          ((eq item '&whole)
   193â†’           (unless (eq state :start)
   194â†’             (error 'program-error
   195â†’                    :format-control "&whole must appear first in lambda-list"))
   196â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   197â†’           (unless remaining
   198â†’             (error 'program-error
   199â†’                    :format-control "&whole requires a variable name"))
   200â†’           (setf whole-var (car remaining))
   201â†’           (unless (symbolp whole-var)
   202â†’             (error 'program-error
   203â†’                    :format-control "&whole variable must be a symbol, got: ~S"
   204â†’                    :format-arguments (list whole-var)))
   205â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   206â†’           (setf state :after-whole))
   207â†’
   208â†’          ;; &optional
   209â†’          ((eq item '&optional)
   210â†’           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required))
   211â†’             (error 'program-error
   212â†’                    :format-control "&optional in wrong position"))
   213â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   214â†’           (setf state :optional)
   215â†’           ;; Collect optional params until next keyword or end
   216â†’           (loop while (and remaining (not (lambda-list-keyword-p (car remaining))))
   217â†’                 do (push (parse-optional-param (car remaining)) optional-params)
   218â†’                    (setf remaining (cdr remaining)))
   219â†’           (setf optional-params (nreverse optional-params)))
   220â†’
   221â†’          ;; &rest or &body
   222â†’          ((member item '(&rest &body))
   223â†’           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required :optional))
   224â†’             (error 'program-error
   225â†’                    :format-control "~S in wrong position" :format-arguments (list item)))
   226â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   227â†’           (unless remaining
   228â†’             (error 'program-error
   229â†’                    :format-control "~S requires a variable name" :format-arguments (list item)))
   230â†’           (setf rest-var (car remaining))
   231â†’           (unless (symbolp rest-var)
   232â†’             (error 'program-error
   233â†’                    :format-control "~S variable must be a symbol, got: ~S"
   234â†’                    :format-arguments (list item rest-var)))
   235â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   236â†’           (setf state :rest))
   237â†’
   238â†’          ;; &key
   239â†’          ((eq item '&key)
   240â†’           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required :optional :rest))
   241â†’             (error 'program-error
   242â†’                    :format-control "&key in wrong position"))
   243â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   244â†’           (setf state :key)
   245â†’           ;; Collect key params until next keyword or end
   246â†’           (loop while (and remaining (not (lambda-list-keyword-p (car remaining))))
   247â†’                 do (push (parse-key-param (car remaining)) key-params)
   248â†’                    (setf remaining (cdr remaining)))
   249â†’           (setf key-params (nreverse key-params)))
   250â†’
   251â†’          ;; &allow-other-keys
   252â†’          ((eq item '&allow-other-keys)
   253â†’           (unless (eq state :key)
   254â†’             (error 'program-error
   255â†’                    :format-control "&allow-other-keys must follow &key"))
   256â†’           (setf allow-other-keys-p t)
   257â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   258â†’           (setf state :allow-keys))
   259â†’
   260â†’          ;; Regular parameter (required)
   261â†’          ((not (lambda-list-keyword-p item))
   262â†’           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required))
   263â†’             (error 'program-error
   264â†’                    :format-control "Required parameter ~S in wrong position"
   265â†’                    :format-arguments (list item)))
   266â†’           (push (parse-param item) required-params)
   267â†’           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   268â†’           (setf state :required))
   269â†’
   270â†’          ;; Unknown lambda-list keyword
   271â†’          (t
   272â†’           (error 'program-error
   273â†’                  :format-control "Unknown lambda-list keyword: ~S"
   274â†’                  :format-arguments (list item))))))
   275â†’
   276â†’    (make-parsed-lambda-list
   277â†’     :whole-var whole-var
   278â†’     :required-params (nreverse required-params)
   279â†’     :optional-params optional-params
   280â†’     :rest-var rest-var
   281â†’     :key-params key-params
   282â†’     :allow-other-keys-p allow-other-keys-p)))
   283â†’
   284â†’;;; ============================================================
   285â†’;;; Code Generation (Outside-In with List Threading)
   286â†’;;; ============================================================
   287â†’
   288â†’(defun generate-destructuring-code (parsed-ll list-form body)
   289â†’  "Generate code to destructure LIST-FORM according to PARSED-LL.
   290â†’   Returns a form that binds all variables and evaluates BODY.
   291â†’
   292â†’   PARSED-LL: A parsed-lambda-list structure
   293â†’   LIST-FORM: The form to destructure (usually a gensym-bound variable)
   294â†’   BODY: The body forms to evaluate after binding
   295â†’
   296â†’   Code generation works OUTSIDE-IN:
   297â†’   1. &whole binding (outermost)
   298â†’   2. Required bindings (consume from list, pass remainder)
   299â†’   3. &optional bindings (consume from remainder, pass new remainder)
   300â†’   4. &rest/&body binding (bind to final remainder)
   301â†’   5. &key bindings (extract from plist in &rest or remaining)"
   302â†’  (let* ((whole-var (parsed-lambda-list-whole-var parsed-ll))
   303â†’         (required (parsed-lambda-list-required-params parsed-ll))
   304â†’         (optional (parsed-lambda-list-optional-params parsed-ll))
   305â†’         (rest-var (parsed-lambda-list-rest-var parsed-ll))
   306â†’         (key-params (parsed-lambda-list-key-params parsed-ll))
   307â†’         (allow-other-keys-p (parsed-lambda-list-allow-other-keys-p parsed-ll))
   308â†’         (initial-list (gensym "LIST-"))
   309â†’         (has-rest-or-key-p (or rest-var key-params))
   310â†’         (has-more-p (or optional rest-var key-params)))
   311â†’
   312â†’    ;; Build the innermost continuation (body + &key if present)
   313â†’    (labels ((make-final-code (final-list-var)
   314â†’               ;; Generate the innermost code: &key bindings around body
   315â†’               (if key-params
   316â†’                   (generate-key-bindings key-params final-list-var
   317â†’                                          allow-other-keys-p body)
   318â†’                   (cons 'progn body)))
   319â†’
   320â†’             (wrap-rest (list-var continuation-fn)
   321â†’               ;; Wrap with &rest binding, passing bound var to continuation
   322â†’               (if rest-var
   323â†’                   `(let ((,rest-var ,list-var))
   324â†’                      ,(funcall continuation-fn rest-var))
   325â†’                   (funcall continuation-fn list-var)))
   326â†’
   327â†’             (generate-optional-chain (params list-var continuation-fn)
   328â†’               ;; Generate optional bindings, passing final remainder to continuation
   329â†’               (if (null params)
   330â†’                   (wrap-rest list-var continuation-fn)
   331â†’                   (let* ((param (first params))
   332â†’                          (remaining (rest params))
   333â†’                          (pspec (optional-param-spec-param param))
   334â†’                          (default (optional-param-spec-default-form param))
   335â†’                          (supplied-p (optional-param-spec-supplied-p param))
   336â†’                          (next-var (gensym "REST-")))
   337â†’                     (case (param-spec-type pspec)
   338â†’                       (:variable
   339â†’                        (let ((var (param-spec-var pspec)))
   340â†’                          (if supplied-p
   341â†’                              `(if (consp ,list-var)
   342â†’                                   (let ((,var (car ,list-var))
   343â†’                                         (,supplied-p t)
   344â†’                                         (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
   345â†’                                     ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))
   346â†’                                   (let ((,var ,default)
   347â†’                                         (,supplied-p nil)
   348â†’                                         (,next-var nil))
   349â†’                                     ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))
   350â†’                              `(let* ((,var (if (consp ,list-var) (car ,list-var) ,default))
   351â†’                                      (,next-var (if (consp ,list-var) (cdr ,list-var) nil)))
   352â†’                                 ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))))
   353â†’                       (:nested
   354â†’                        (let ((elem-var (gensym "ELEM-")))
   355â†’                          `(if (consp ,list-var)
   356â†’                               (let ((,elem-var (car ,list-var))
   357â†’                                     (,next-var (cdr ,list-var))
   358â†’                                     ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p t))))
   359â†’                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
   360â†’                                   (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
   361â†’                                   elem-var
   362â†’                                   (list (generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))))
   363â†’                               (let ((,elem-var ,default)
   364â†’                                     (,next-var nil)
   365â†’                                     ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p nil))))
   366â†’                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
   367â†’                                   (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
   368â†’                                   elem-var
   369â†’                                   (list (generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))))))))))
   370â†’
   371â†’             (generate-required-chain (params list-var continuation-fn)
   372â†’               ;; Generate required bindings, passing final remainder to continuation
   373â†’               (if (null params)
   374â†’                   ;; All required consumed - continue to optional/rest/key or check excess
   375â†’                   (if has-more-p
   376â†’                       ;; Has optional/rest/key - continue processing
   377â†’                       (if optional
   378â†’                           (generate-optional-chain optional list-var continuation-fn)
   379â†’                           (wrap-rest list-var continuation-fn))
   380â†’                       ;; No optional/rest/key - check for excess elements
   381â†’                       `(if (consp ,list-var)
   382â†’                            (error 'program-error
   383â†’                                   :format-control "Too many elements for destructuring")
   384â†’                            ,(funcall continuation-fn list-var)))
   385â†’                   (let* ((param (first params))
   386â†’                          (remaining (rest params))
   387â†’                          (next-var (gensym "REST-")))
   388â†’                     (case (param-spec-type param)
   389â†’                       (:variable
   390â†’                        `(if (consp ,list-var)
   391â†’                             (let ((,(param-spec-var param) (car ,list-var))
   392â†’                                   (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
   393â†’                               ,(generate-required-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))
   394â†’                             (error 'program-error
   395â†’                                    :format-control "Too few elements for destructuring: expected ~A"
   396â†’                                    :format-arguments (list ',(param-spec-var param)))))
   397â†’                       (:nested
   398â†’                        (let ((elem-var (gensym "ELEM-")))
